title: Wand of wishing
data:
| /               |                                                               |
| --------------- | ------------------------------------------------------------- |
| Name            | wishing                                                       |
| Appearance      | [random](/wiki/Randomised_appearance "Randomised appearance") |
| Abundance       | [0.5%](/wiki/Wand#Generation "Wand")                          |
| Base price      | 500 [zm](/wiki/Zorkmid "Zorkmid")                             |
| Weight          | 7                                                             |
| Type            | non-directional                                               |
| Maximum charges | 3                                                             |
| Monster use     | *Will not be used by monsters.*                               |

A **wand of wishing** is a type of [wand](/wiki/Wand "Wand") that appears in *[NetHack](/wiki/NetHack "NetHack")*, and is one of the most sought-after wands in the game.

[ ]

## Contents

- [1 Generation](#Generation)

- [2 Description](#Description)

- [3 Strategy](#Strategy)

  - [3.1 Charging](#Charging)
  - [3.2 Wish extraction](#Wish_extraction)

- [4 Variants](#Variants)

  - [4.1 UnNetHack](#UnNetHack)
  - [4.2 NetHack Fourk](#NetHack_Fourk)
  - [4.3 xNetHack](#xNetHack)
  - [4.4 SpliceHack](#SpliceHack)

- [5 See also](#See_also)

- [6 References](#References)

## Generation

Wands of wishing are the rarest wand type, making up only 1⁄200 of all randomly-generated wands.

A wand of wishing is always generated in a [chest](/wiki/Chest "Chest") within one of the turrets of the [Castle](/wiki/Castle "Castle") at level creation.

A wand of wishing can only have up to 3 charges at most.[\[1\]](#cite_note-1) [Wishing](/wiki/Wishing "Wishing") for a wand of wishing has a 9⁄10 chance of creating a pre-charged wand of wishing with charges set to -1 (i.e. [cancelled](/wiki/Cancelled "Cancelled")), and will otherwise generate one with zero charges.

## Description

- *Main article: [Wish](/wiki/Wish "Wish")*

[Zapping](/wiki/Zapping "Zapping") or [engraving](/wiki/Engraving "Engraving") with a wand of wishing will grant a wish if the character has non-negative [luck](/wiki/Luck "Luck"), [auto-identifying](/wiki/Auto-identify "Auto-identify") the wand - wishing will increase [prayer](/wiki/Prayer "Prayer") timeout. A wand of wishing can only be recharged once, and will explode if recharged again or its charges are set above 3.[\[2\]](#cite_note-2)[\[3\]](#cite_note-3)

## Strategy

- *Main article: [Wish#Strategy](/wiki/Wish#Strategy "Wish")*

If you come across a wand with a base cost of 500 in a shop, it is either a wand of wishing or a [wand of death](/wiki/Wand_of_death "Wand of death"), both of which are well worth purchasing, even if you must take the time for [credit cloning](/wiki/Credit_cloning "Credit cloning") or gathering [junk](/wiki/Junk "Junk"). If you have no pet or are otherwise unable to do this, you may choose instead to wish for gold. See the wish article's [section on early wands of wishing](/wiki/Wish#Early_wands_of_wishing "Wish") for detailed instructions.

### Charging

Your first wish from this wand should be a source of [charging](/wiki/Charging "Charging"), if you do not already have one. This typically involves wishing for 2 or 3 [blessed](/wiki/Blessed "Blessed") [scrolls of charging](/wiki/Scroll_of_charging "Scroll of charging"). If you have already identified charging scrolls, you should wish for a [magic marker](/wiki/Magic_marker "Magic marker") and write your own. [Wizards](/wiki/Wizard "Wizard") with high [Luck](/wiki/Luck "Luck") have a good chance of writing unknown scrolls, and should generally wish for a magic marker.

The other source of charging is [the Platinum Yendorian Express Card](/wiki/The_Platinum_Yendorian_Express_Card "The Platinum Yendorian Express Card"), but wishing for this to recharge your wand is a bad idea unless you are [illiterate](/wiki/Illiterate "Illiterate"), because [Tourists](/wiki/Tourist "Tourist") will not receive it at all, and other roles cannot perform blessed charging with it, so 1–2 of your wand's potential charges might be lost. Since Tourists can acquire the Platinum Yendorian Express Card on their quest, they may choose not to wish for a source of charging, and delay using their final wishes until they can complete their quest.

### Wish extraction

*Never* use a wand of wishing while your [Luck](/wiki/Luck "Luck") is negative, because there is a chance that your wish will be lost. (*"Unfortunately, nothing happens."*)[\[4\]](#cite_note-4)

How to extract the maximum number of wishes follows:

1. [Zap](/wiki/Zap "Zap") or [engrave](/wiki/Engrave "Engrave") with the wand until it reaches (0:0).
2. Blessed-recharge the wand (this will bring the wand up to (1:3), while an uncursed scroll would bring it to (1:d3)).
3. [Zap](/wiki/Zap "Zap") or [engrave](/wiki/Engrave "Engrave") with the wand until it reaches (1:0).
4. [Zap](/wiki/Zap "Zap") or [engrave](/wiki/Engrave "Engrave") with the wand repeatedly to [wrest](/wiki/Wrest "Wrest") the last charge.

If you fear the RNG, you may want to identify the wand first to find out how many charges it has left, rather than [engraving](/wiki/Engraving "Engraving") until you get no message; although rare, there is no worse feeling than accidentally wresting the last charge out of a wand you meant to recharge.

## Variants

### UnNetHack

In [UnNetHack](/wiki/UnNetHack "UnNetHack"), wands of wishing are generated in a (1:*x*) state, as if they had already been recharged once. This effectively means that wands of wishing cannot be recharged, so scrolls of charging should not be wished for unless they're needed for some other purpose.

In addition, in UnNetHack, if a wand doesn't successfully wrest immediately, the wand turns to dust, but wresting chance was increased from 1⁄121 to 1⁄5 for blessed, 1⁄6 for uncursed and 1⁄7 for cursed wands.

The reduced charges of wands of wishing effectively mean UnNetHack games have 1–4 guaranteed wishes (1–3 charges plus a potential [wrest](/wiki/Wresting "Wresting")), whereas vanilla *NetHack* games have 5–7 guaranteed wishes (1–3 charges, plus 3 recharged, plus a guaranteed wrest). In the latter case, one of those wishes is usually spent on scrolls of charging, so the effective number of guaranteed wishes in vanilla is 4–6.

### NetHack Fourk

In [NetHack Fourk](/wiki/NetHack_Fourk "NetHack Fourk"), similar to UnNetHack, wands of wishing come precharged, but still spawn with the usual 1–3 charges, and not wresting immediately will not make the wand turn to dust. Wresting was made easier in Fourk. To compensate for this, Fourk adds a guranteed [scroll of wishing](/wiki/Scroll_of_wishing "Scroll of wishing") to Orcus, Vlad's Tower's top floor, and Wizard's Tower's top floor.

### xNetHack

In [xNetHack](/wiki/XNetHack "XNetHack"), wands of wishing cannot be recharged, though their state is displayed as (0:*x*) rather than (1:*x*). When they reach 0 charges, they immediately turn to dust, so wresting them is impossible.

They are no longer generated randomly; instead, statically-placed wands of wishing are found in the [Castle](/wiki/Castle "Castle"), the top floor of [Vlad's Tower](/wiki/Vlad%27s_Tower "Vlad's Tower"), the [Fake Wizard's Tower](/wiki/Fake_Wizard%27s_Tower "Fake Wizard's Tower") that lacks the magic portal, the top floor of the real [Wizard's Tower](/wiki/Wizard%27s_Tower "Wizard's Tower"), and the northeastern room of [Moloch's Sanctum](/wiki/Moloch%27s_Sanctum "Moloch's Sanctum"). All of these are generated with 1 charge, except the Castle's, which has 2.

### SpliceHack

In [SpliceHack](/wiki/SpliceHack "SpliceHack"), wands of wishing are handled the same as in xNetHack, with several individual wands scattered across [Gehennom](/wiki/Gehennom "Gehennom"), although the wand found in [Vlad's Tower](/wiki/Vlad%27s_Tower "Vlad's Tower") is cursed.

## See also

- [RGRN post](http://groups.google.com/group/rec.games.roguelike.nethack/browse_thread/thread/33d67d11146dc784#): exploding wands of wishing really do happen

## References

1. [↑](#cite_ref-1) [src/read.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 478](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/src/read.c#L478)
2. [↑](#cite_ref-2) [src/read.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 521](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/src/read.c#L521)
3. [↑](#cite_ref-3) [src/read.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 521](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/src/read.c#L521)
4. [↑](#cite_ref-4) [zap.c in NetHack 3.4.3, line 1790](/wiki/Source:NetHack_3.4.3/zap.c#line1790 "Source:NetHack 3.4.3/zap.c")

[![This article has been updated to reflect NetHack 3.6.7. Click here for more information.](/images/f/f7/Nh367-icon.png)](/wiki/NetHackWiki:Next_version "This article has been updated to reflect NetHack 3.6.7. Click here for more information.")
html:
Wand of wishing

From NetHackWiki
Jump to navigation Jump to search
/
Name wishing
Appearance random
Abundance 0.5%
Base price 500 zm
Weight 7
Type non-directional
Maximum charges 3
Monster use Will not be used by monsters.

A wand of wishing is a type of wand that appears in NetHack, and is one of the most sought-after wands in the game.

Contents

  • 1 Generation
  • 2 Description
  • 3 Strategy
    • 3.1 Charging
    • 3.2 Wish extraction
  • 4 Variants
    • 4.1 UnNetHack
    • 4.2 NetHack Fourk
    • 4.3 xNetHack
    • 4.4 SpliceHack
  • 5 See also
  • 6 References

Generation

Wands of wishing are the rarest wand type, making up only 1⁄200 of all randomly-generated wands.

A wand of wishing is always generated in a chest within one of the turrets of the Castle at level creation.

A wand of wishing can only have up to 3 charges at most.[1] Wishing for a wand of wishing has a 9⁄10 chance of creating a pre-charged wand of wishing with charges set to -1 (i.e. cancelled), and will otherwise generate one with zero charges.

Description

Main article: Wish

Zapping or engraving with a wand of wishing will grant a wish if the character has non-negative luck, auto-identifying the wand - wishing will increase prayer timeout. A wand of wishing can only be recharged once, and will explode if recharged again or its charges are set above 3.[2][3]

Strategy

Main article: Wish#Strategy

If you come across a wand with a base cost of 500 in a shop, it is either a wand of wishing or a wand of death, both of which are well worth purchasing, even if you must take the time for credit cloning or gathering junk. If you have no pet or are otherwise unable to do this, you may choose instead to wish for gold. See the wish article's section on early wands of wishing for detailed instructions.

Charging

Your first wish from this wand should be a source of charging, if you do not already have one. This typically involves wishing for 2 or 3 blessed scrolls of charging. If you have already identified charging scrolls, you should wish for a magic marker and write your own. Wizards with high Luck have a good chance of writing unknown scrolls, and should generally wish for a magic marker.

The other source of charging is the Platinum Yendorian Express Card, but wishing for this to recharge your wand is a bad idea unless you are illiterate, because Tourists will not receive it at all, and other roles cannot perform blessed charging with it, so 1–2 of your wand's potential charges might be lost. Since Tourists can acquire the Platinum Yendorian Express Card on their quest, they may choose not to wish for a source of charging, and delay using their final wishes until they can complete their quest.

Wish extraction

Never use a wand of wishing while your Luck is negative, because there is a chance that your wish will be lost. ("Unfortunately, nothing happens.")[4]

How to extract the maximum number of wishes follows:

  1. Zap or engrave with the wand until it reaches (0:0).
  2. Blessed-recharge the wand (this will bring the wand up to (1:3), while an uncursed scroll would bring it to (1:d3)).
  3. Zap or engrave with the wand until it reaches (1:0).
  4. Zap or engrave with the wand repeatedly to wrest the last charge.

If you fear the RNG, you may want to identify the wand first to find out how many charges it has left, rather than engraving until you get no message; although rare, there is no worse feeling than accidentally wresting the last charge out of a wand you meant to recharge.

Variants

UnNetHack

In UnNetHack, wands of wishing are generated in a (1:x) state, as if they had already been recharged once. This effectively means that wands of wishing cannot be recharged, so scrolls of charging should not be wished for unless they're needed for some other purpose.

In addition, in UnNetHack, if a wand doesn't successfully wrest immediately, the wand turns to dust, but wresting chance was increased from 1⁄121 to 1⁄5 for blessed, 1⁄6 for uncursed and 1⁄7 for cursed wands.

The reduced charges of wands of wishing effectively mean UnNetHack games have 1–4 guaranteed wishes (1–3 charges plus a potential wrest), whereas vanilla NetHack games have 5–7 guaranteed wishes (1–3 charges, plus 3 recharged, plus a guaranteed wrest). In the latter case, one of those wishes is usually spent on scrolls of charging, so the effective number of guaranteed wishes in vanilla is 4–6.

NetHack Fourk

In NetHack Fourk, similar to UnNetHack, wands of wishing come precharged, but still spawn with the usual 1–3 charges, and not wresting immediately will not make the wand turn to dust. Wresting was made easier in Fourk. To compensate for this, Fourk adds a guranteed scroll of wishing to Orcus, Vlad's Tower's top floor, and Wizard's Tower's top floor.

xNetHack

In xNetHack, wands of wishing cannot be recharged, though their state is displayed as (0:x) rather than (1:x). When they reach 0 charges, they immediately turn to dust, so wresting them is impossible.

They are no longer generated randomly; instead, statically-placed wands of wishing are found in the Castle, the top floor of Vlad's Tower, the Fake Wizard's Tower that lacks the magic portal, the top floor of the real Wizard's Tower, and the northeastern room of Moloch's Sanctum. All of these are generated with 1 charge, except the Castle's, which has 2.

SpliceHack

In SpliceHack, wands of wishing are handled the same as in xNetHack, with several individual wands scattered across Gehennom, although the wand found in Vlad's Tower is cursed.

See also

  • RGRN post: exploding wands of wishing really do happen

References

  1. ↑ src/read.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 478
  2. ↑ src/read.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 521
  3. ↑ src/read.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 521
  4. ↑ zap.c in NetHack 3.4.3, line 1790

A '''wand of wishing''' is a type of [[wand]] that appears in ''[[NetHack]]'', and is one of the most sought-after wands in the game.

==Generation==
Wands of wishing are the rarest wand type, making up only {{frac|200}} of all randomly-generated wands.

A wand of wishing is always generated in a [[chest]] within one of the turrets of the [[Castle]] at level creation.

A wand of wishing can only have up to 3 charges at most.{{refsrc|src/read.c|478|nethack=3.6.7}} [[Wishing]] for a wand of wishing has a {{frac|9|10}} chance of creating a pre-charged wand of wishing with charges set to -1 (i.e. [[cancelled]]), and will otherwise generate one with zero charges. 

==Description==
{{main|Wish}}
[[Zapping]] or [[engraving]] with a wand of wishing will grant a wish if the character has non-negative [[luck]], [[auto-identify]]ing the wand - wishing will increase [[prayer]] timeout. A wand of wishing can only be recharged once, and will explode if recharged again or its charges are set above 3.{{refsrc|src/read.c|521|nethack=3.6.7}}{{refsrc|src/read.c|521|nethack=3.6.7}}

==Strategy==
{{main|Wish#Strategy}}
If you come across a wand with a base cost of 500 in a shop, it is either a wand of wishing or a [[wand of death]], both of which are well worth purchasing, even if you must take the time for [[credit cloning]] or gathering [[junk]]. If you have no pet or are otherwise unable to do this, you may choose instead to wish for gold. See the wish article's [[Wish#Early wands of wishing|section on early wands of wishing]] for detailed instructions.

===Charging===
Your first wish from this wand should be a source of [[charging]], if you do not already have one. This typically involves wishing for 2 or 3 [[blessed]] [[scroll of charging|scrolls of charging]]. If you have already identified charging scrolls, you should wish for a [[magic marker]] and write your own. [[Wizard]]s with high [[Luck]] have a good chance of writing unknown scrolls, and should generally wish for a magic marker.

The other source of charging is [[the Platinum Yendorian Express Card]], but wishing for this to recharge your wand is a bad idea unless you are [[illiterate]], because [[Tourist]]s will not receive it at all, and other roles cannot perform blessed charging with it, so 1–2 of your wand's potential charges might be lost. Since Tourists can acquire the Platinum Yendorian Express Card on their quest, they may choose not to wish for a source of charging, and delay using their final wishes until they can complete their quest.

=== Wish extraction ===
''Never'' use a wand of wishing while your [[Luck]] is negative, because there is a chance that your wish will be lost. (''"Unfortunately, nothing happens."''){{refsrc|zap.c|1790}}

How to extract the maximum number of wishes follows:
# [[Zap]] or [[engrave]] with the wand until it reaches (0:0).
# Blessed-recharge the wand (this will bring the wand up to (1:3), while an uncursed scroll would bring it to (1:d3)).
# [[Zap]] or [[engrave]] with the wand until it reaches (1:0).
# [[Zap]] or [[engrave]] with the wand repeatedly to [[wrest]] the last charge.

If you fear the RNG, you may want to identify the wand first to find out how many charges it has left, rather than [[engraving]] until you get no message; although rare, there is no worse feeling than accidentally wresting the last charge out of a wand you meant to recharge.

==Variants==
===UnNetHack===
In [[UnNetHack]], wands of wishing are generated in a (1:''x'') state, as if they had already been recharged once. This effectively means that wands of wishing cannot be recharged, so scrolls of charging should not be wished for unless they're needed for some other purpose.

In addition, in UnNetHack, if a wand doesn't successfully wrest immediately, the wand turns to dust, but wresting chance was increased from {{frac|121}} to {{frac|5}} for blessed, {{frac|6}} for uncursed and {{frac|7}} for cursed wands.

The reduced charges of wands of wishing effectively mean UnNetHack games have 1–4 guaranteed wishes (1–3 charges plus a potential [[Wresting|wrest]]), whereas vanilla ''NetHack'' games have 5–7 guaranteed wishes (1–3 charges, plus 3 recharged, plus a guaranteed wrest). In the latter case, one of those wishes is usually spent on scrolls of charging, so the effective number of guaranteed wishes in vanilla is 4–6.

===NetHack Fourk===
In [[NetHack Fourk]], similar to UnNetHack, wands of wishing come precharged, but still spawn with the usual 1–3 charges, and not wresting immediately will not make the wand turn to dust. Wresting was made easier in Fourk. To compensate for this, Fourk adds a guranteed [[scroll of wishing]] to Orcus, Vlad's Tower's top floor, and Wizard's Tower's top floor.

===xNetHack===
In [[xNetHack]], wands of wishing cannot be recharged, though their state is displayed as (0:''x'') rather than (1:''x''). When they reach 0 charges, they immediately turn to dust, so wresting them is impossible.

They are no longer generated randomly; instead, statically-placed wands of wishing are found in the [[Castle]], the top floor of [[Vlad's Tower]], the [[Fake Wizard's Tower]] that lacks the magic portal, the top floor of the real [[Wizard's Tower]], and the northeastern room of [[Moloch's Sanctum]]. All of these are generated with 1 charge, except the Castle's, which has 2.

===SpliceHack===
In [[SpliceHack]], wands of wishing are handled the same as in xNetHack, with several individual wands scattered across [[Gehennom]], although the wand found in [[Vlad's Tower]] is cursed.
